sense.def: Pathological Condition identical with lao dan 勞疸 , exhaustion with dan -illness. Zhu bing yuan hou lun 諸病源候論 12: 額 上黑，微汗出，手足中熱，薄暮發，膀胱急，四肢煩，小便自利，名為 勞黃 , “If at dusk the forehead is darkened, with slight sweating, and heat affecting hands and feet, the bladder cramps, the four limbs vexed, and urine flows by itself, this is called ‘ exhaustion jaundice ’”. Lao ji 勞極 , exhaustion to the extreme [15]

Pathological Condition of a state of xu lao 虛勞 , depletion exhaustion, that is an apparent state of kidney depletion. Shen nong ben cao jing 神農本草經 Substance Entry a jiao 阿膠：勞極，洒洒如瘧狀，腰腹痛，四肢 酸疼，女子下血，安胎 ”[It cures] exhaustion extreme; [patients] shiver as if they suffered from malaria. Their lower back and abdomen ache. Their four limbs are painful. Women lose blood. It pacifies a fetus”.
